titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Women Writing Women's Lives Records TAM.316
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hillel Arnold

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-12-11T15:14-0500

change.item: Edited by Rachel Schimke for compliance with DACS and Tamiment Required Elements for Archival Description and to reflect the incorporation of nonprint materials in 2013. Further edited by Heather Mulliner to incorporate November 2013 donation

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

physdesc.extent: in 2 record cartons and 3 manuscript boxes

did.abstract: Founded in 1990, Women Writing Women's Lives is an ongoing seminar of about sixty women engaged in writing book-length biographies and memoirs, affiliated with the Center for the Study of Women and Society and the Center for the Humanities at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York. Members meet monthly to present work for discussion, share ideas, and hear about the work of outside presenters. The collection consists of administrative files, subject files, and notes and lectures from the group's monthly meetings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The Women Writing Women's Lives Records were given to the Tamiment Library in January 2004 by Kathy Chamberlain, Steering Committee Chair. An additional donation was made in 2010 by Norah Chase. In 2008, a donation of 57 photographs was made by Claire Morris Stern, chair of the Archives Committee of WWWL. Additionally Claire Morris Stern's donated a portion of her personal files to the collection in 2013. The accession number associated with this gift is 2013.044.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Women Writing Women's Lives Records; TAM 316; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Photographs separated from this collection during initial processing and from new accessions were established as a separate collection, the Women Writing Women's Lives Photographs (PHOTOS 266). In 2013, the photograph collection was reincorporated into the Women Writing Women's Lives Records (TAM 316).

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1990, Women Writing Women's Lives is an ongoing seminar of about sixty women engaged in writing book-length biographies and memoirs. Its members include academics, poets, journalists and novelists. Women Writing Women's Lives is under the aegis of the Center for the Study of Women and Society and the Center for the Humanities at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.
Monthly meetings, planned by a Steering Committee, are arranged in order for members to present work for discussion, share ideas, and hear about the work of outside presenters.

list.item: Women Writing Womenâ€™s Lives (WWWL) Seminar. http://web.gc.cuny.edu/womencenter/wwwl/

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the materials of Women Writing Women's Lives and its members. The collection is primarily comprised of proceedings from monthly meetings, but also includes materials such as membership questionnaires, correspondence, photographs of members and meetings, and subject files. The collection also contians the administrative files of Claire Morris Stern, who was a founding member of the organization served as the chair of the Archive Committee. Her files contain correspondence, photographs, and materials related to special events including the Women Writing Women's Lives 20th Anniversary celebration.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
relatedmaterial.p: Women Writing Women's Lives Oral History Collection (OH 059)

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials related to the donation of Women Writing Women's Lives Records to Tamiment have been removed from the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series. Series I is arranged alphabetically. Series II contains the records of founding member Claire Morris Sterns and has been left in its original order. Series III is arranged chronologically.

Series I: General Files
Series II: Claire Morris Stern Records
Series III: Session Records

controlaccess.corpname: City University of New York. Center for the Study of Women and Society.
City University of New York. Graduate School and University Center.
controlaccess.subject: Women biographers.
Women |v Biography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The General Files consist of administrative records such as membership applications and questionnaires, financial records, and minutes of the Steering Committee meetings. Clipping and subject files on topics related to women's biography and biographers and photographs of members at a 2008 meeting (where Salli Bingham was the guest speaker) are also included.

did.unittitle: Book Covers of Publications by Members
Grant Proposal (New York Council for the Humanities)
Series II: Claire Morris Stern Records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Session Records contain announcements, attendance sheets, lectures and notes from the organization's monthly meetings. Names of lecturers are indicated in the folder title.
